briefdescription.para: view is the view class of a tic tac toe game.
board is the model that represents the underlying layer of a game.
cells are the collection of cell buttons built by the view class.
options is the collection of values and flags that controls the game.
currentPlayer is the player that will play the current turn.
agent is the AI agent chosen to play against the human player.
setConnections will set a connection to all GUI elements to slots defined to handle these events.
resets all internal components, the view, the model and the AI agent. then if AI is supposed to start a game it will play first.
updateGameState updates the view and the model and switches the current player.

parameterdescription.para: the clicked cell that the player chooses.

briefdescription.para: AIAgentPlay calls the AI agent to play given the current board inputs.
HumanPlay calls the Speech Recognition Engine for decoding input into Cell.
switchPlayer switches the current player mark (X to O and O to X).

parameterdescription.para: is the collection of values and flags that controls the game.
is a QObject type parent that owns this instance of the controller.

briefdescription.para: startGame executes this QDialog to show the GUI and start the gameplay.
turnFinished is emitted when the human player is finished with the cell input, and the internal game state is supposed to be updated.
updateGame sets the cell clicked in the model (board).

parameterdescription.para: the clicked cell that the player chooses.

briefdescription.para: The TTTController class is the controller for a Tic Tac Toe game, it takes in game options as input, and controls the view (TicTacToeGame) and the model (Board) according to the game logic specified in this class, it is also responsible for calling the AI agent to play its turn if specified by the game options.
